lead_paragraph: O.K., so perhaps Conan O'Brien's "Show Zero," the sneak preview of his new TBS show that was simulcast around the Web on Monday night, was not the in-depth test run that some of us assumed it would be. But who's to say it wasn't the model of the hyper-efficient late-night show of the 21st century? In just five minutes, you got one monologue joke, one band member, one celebrity guest, one chord performed by a visiting rock band and three Diet Coke commercials. (And zero self-righteous speeches about the evil news media.) At a cost of zero dollars, you got your money's worth.
snippet: If brevity is the soul of wit, a sneak preview of Mr. O'Brien's new TBS show certainly was brief.

headline.main: Crunching the Numbers on Conan O'Brien's 'Show Zero'

abstract: If brevity is the soul of wit, a sneak preview of Mr. O'Brien's new TBS show certainly was brief.
